intro: Malacothamnus fasciculatus var. nesioticus, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. This variety is distinguished by its smaller, more clustered flower clusters compared to other varieties of Malacothamnus.
